title: PRECIOUS-Gold edges up on rate cut bets, firmer equities limit upside
text:
© Reuters. PRECIOUS-Gold edges up on rate cut bets, firmer equities limit upside

* Speculators raise bullish COMEX gold, silver bets- CFTC

* In short-term, gold unlikely to dip below $1,500/oz- analyst

* Silver slips to two-week low; Palladium jumps 1% (New throughout, adds comments, updates prices)

By Brijesh Patel

Sept 9 (Reuters) - Gold edged higher on Monday, crawling away from a two-week low touched in the previous session, supported by hopes of monetary policy easing by major central banks although the metal's advance was capped by improved appetite for riskier assets.

Spot gold was up 0.2% at $1,509.01 per ounce, as of 1001 GMT. The metal touched $1,502.50 on Friday, a level last seen on Aug. 23.

U.S. GCv1 were up 0.1% at $1,517.40 an ounce.

"Gold has been retreating because of risk appetite returning to the market, so the concerns (over U.S.-China trade ties and global growth) seem to be subdued," Commerzbank (DE: ) analyst Eugen Weinberg said, adding that monetary easing by central banks could drive a rally in gold in the medium term.

"We're likely to see a pause in the upward tend, but the trend is still intact."

Financial markets around the world rose on Monday, with European stocks hovering near a one-month high after data showed a surprise rise in German exports and on firmer expectations of fresh stimulus by the European Central Bank later this week. MKTS/GLOB sentiment was also lifted on Friday after China said it would slash the amount of cash that banks must hold as reserves, while U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank would continue to "act as appropriate" to sustain economic expansion. comments and a mixed U.S. employment report bolstered expectations for a rate cut at the Fed's Sept. 17-18 policy meeting. the ECB and Fed primed to further ease monetary conditions this month, it is unlikely gold will dip below $1,500/oz in the short-term," Howie Lee, economist at OCBC Bank said in a note.

Lower interest rates decrease the opportunity cost of holding non-yielding bullion and weigh on the dollar, making gold cheaper for investors holding other currencies.

Meanwhile, the dollar was steady against a basket of major currencies. USD/

Hedge funds and money managers hiked their bullish positions in COMEX gold and silver contracts in the week to Sept. 3, the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) said on Friday. the technical side, spot gold is expected to test a support at $1,497 per ounce, a break below which could cause a further fall to $1,453, according to Reuters technical analyst Wang Tao. silver eased 0.1% to $18.14 per ounce after falling to a near two-week low of $17.89 earlier in the session.

Palladium jumped 1% to $1,551.48 an ounce and platinum gained 0.3% to $952.38.
description: PRECIOUS-Gold edges up on rate cut bets, firmer equities limit upside
